analyzed: kusuma asani yat thera apadāna  nagare dhaññavatiyā
translated: The Elder Kusumāsaniyatthera’s Birth Story🔽“At that time I was a brahmin
in the city of Dhaññavatī.
I was skilled in the Lakkhaṇa, Itihāsa,
and the Nighaṇḍu and the Sāketa.
I was a grammarian,
and I was skilled in the omens.
I taught the mantras to my pupils,
and I had mastered the three Vedas.
Five handfuls of lotuses

analyzed: piṭṭhiyam ṭhapitāni me  āhutim yiṭṭhu kāmaḥ uha
translated: were placed on my back,🔽and I wanted to make an offering
to my mother and father.
Then the Fortunate One Vipassī,
with the Community of monks in front,
illuminating all the directions,
was coming, the Best of Men.
After preparing a seat,🔽and inviting the Great Sage,
and spreading out the flowers,
I led him to my own house.
Whatever I had in my own house,
the requisites for a householder,
I offered to the Buddha,
and I was satisfied with my hands.
After he had eaten and knew it was the right time,
I gave him the flowers in my hands.
After the All-Knowing One had expressed his appreciation,
he departed, heading north.
For ninety-one eons,
the flower-intoxication I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the result of the gift of flowers.
In the next world after that,
I was a King called Varadassana;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Kusumāsani recited these verses.
